text:
NAEB RADIO NETWORK
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
To: ALL NETWORK MEMBERS
From: NETWORK MANAGER
Re: SUPPLEMENT #7 TO 1ST QUARTER, 1957 OFFERING
**********
Georgetown Radio Forum (56-51)
Program 23 - Issue 10
Topic: DEATH, TAXES, AND YOU
Panelists: Paul R. Dean, Dean and Professor of Estate Planning, Georgetown Univer¬
sity Law Center;
Edward J. Schmuck, Adjunct Professor of Estate Planning, Georgetown
University, and Vice President of the Acacia Mutual Life Insurance
Co., Washington, D. C.;
Joseph L. Whyte, Adjunct Prof^sor of Estate Planning, Georgetown
University, and Vice President of the American Security and Trust
Co., Washington, D. C.
**********
Dateline Europe (57-2)
Program #8 in this series is being sent with Issue #9* If possible we will try to
send program #9 with Issue #10.
**********
Window on the World (56-45)
Program 21 (issue 12) - ’’Communism's Third Attack” - Sir Hartley Shawcross, M.P.,
well-known lawyer and Labour Member of Parliament, discusses
the Middle East crisis. Sir Hartley sees the Communist
infiltration of the Middle East as its third attack upon the
West, the first two having been the Berlin blockade and Korea,
Program 22 (issue 13) - ”An Australian Looks at Britain” - Morris Barr is an Aus¬
tralian journalist, formerly on the editorial staff of the
Melbourne Argus. He now works in England as a free lance
correspondent on European affairs for Australian papers
and American radio, besides lecturing on international
affairs for various organizations and groups.
**********
